intro: Rhamphicarpa herzfeldiana var. subauriculata, commonly known as the auriculate rhamphicarpa, is a rare and distinctive plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring auriculate (ear-shaped) lobes at the base of the leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has small, tubular flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its botanical features make it of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its ornamental value and ecological significance.
